## INSTRUCTIONS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 435, 808, 574]]<|/det|>
INSTRUCTIONS- Answer all questions.- Use a black or dark blue pen. You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs.- Write your name, centre number and candidate number in the boxes at the top of the page.- Write your answer to each question in the space provided.- Do not use an erasable pen or correction fluid.- Do not write on any bar codes.- You may use a calculator.- You should show all your working and use appropriate units.- Take the weight of \(1.0 \text{kg}\) to be \(10 \text{N}\) (acceleration of free fall \(= 10 \text{m/s}^2\)).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 72, 725, 91]]<|/det|>
Fig. 1.1 shows a piece of glass of thickness \(2.0 \text{cm}\) and area \(0.15 \text{m}^2\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 101, 514, 121]]<|/det|>
The density of the glass is \(2.6 \times 10^{3} \text{kg} / \text{m}^{3}\).

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[306, 131, 702, 275]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>image_caption<|/ref|><|det|>[[408, 291, 591, 310]]<|/det|>
<label>Fig. 1.1 (not to scale)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 338, 500, 356]]<|/det|>
Calculate the weight of the piece of glass.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[534, 432, 920, 450]]<|/det|>
<form>weight = .................................................... [3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 463, 146, 482]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 463, 920, 511]]<|/det|>
The piece of glass shown in Fig. 1.1 is used as the vertical viewing window of an aquarium. The atmospheric pressure outside the aquarium is \(1.0 \times 10^{5} \text{Pa}\). The average pressure on the inside of the aquarium window is \(1.3 \times 10^{5} \text{Pa}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 523, 920, 558]]<|/det|>
Calculate the resultant force acting on the window due to these pressures and state the direction in which it acts.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[544, 631, 917, 650]]<|/det|>
<form>force = ..........................................................

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[450, 663, 920, 681]]<|/det|>
<form>direction of force .......................................................

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 679, 920, 698]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 72, 144, 89]]<|/det|>
<label>(c)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 72, 918, 120]]<|/det|>
